page.title: 08CHERINGTON - CHILDREN'S FOOD
page.content: In the area 54 children aged 5 to 11 responded to questions of diet as follows: 7 out of 8 normally had an uncooked breakfast, only a small minority indulged in bacon and eggs. 19 never ate out at a restaurant; 20 did on average once a month and l5 more often. Packed lunches were eaten by 31 of the sample, 22 had the school cooked meal provided and only one returned home at midday. We thought we would like to find out which families enjoyed a bottle of wine with a meal: 14 said their parents often had wine, 31 said sometimes and 9 never. Finally we investigated children's sweet-eating habits: 14 admitted that they were allowed sweets every day, 32 said once a week, 8 said hardly ever, and no child complained of being totally denied.
